<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/feds-new-inflation-strategy-matters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why the Fed’s New Inflation Strategy Matters
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jerome Powell giving a speech" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMzL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGxfZ2l2aW5nX2Ffc3BlZWNoLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kansas City Fed</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Fed Chair Jerome Powell <em>looks</em> like he’s giving James Bond instructions for a new mission, we can assure you he is talking about a much more exciting topic: monetary policy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a <a href="https://apnews.com/507c21034e441490006e877b080d9584?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keynote address</a> at the Fed’s annual policy symposium, Powell revealed a major update to the central bank’s basic framework for steering the economy through good times and bad.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The update: </strong>The Fed now wants inflation (the rise in prices) to run at a 2% <em>average</em>, rather than a concrete bullseye it needs to hit. That means it will be comfortable with inflation climbing above 2%, a prospect that at one point would scare the bejesus out of central bankers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reason behind the shift: </strong>Powell and his pals thought that historically low unemployment—like the kind we had in 2019—would push up prices and cause higher inflation, but...that <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/03/upshot/unemployment-inflation-changing-economic-fundamentals.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">never happened</a>. Inflation consistently came in below the 2% target despite pretty much everyone having a job. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new change, in Powell’s words, “reflects our view that a robust job market can be sustained without causing an outbreak of inflation.”  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What it means for you </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fed typically hikes interest rates when it’s worried inflation might run too hot. But as we mentioned, it just kissed those worries goodbye. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means interest rates, which the Fed dropped to near-zero in the early days of the pandemic, could stay <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-27/powell-says-fed-to-seek-inflation-that-averages-2-over-time?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>really </em>low</a> for a <em>really </em>long time. The Fed’s benchmark interest rate sets the standard for borrowing costs across the economy, influencing everything from mortgages to the yield on your savings account. So whenever you lock in a super low rate on your home loan or earn $1 in interest over the next year, just say “Thanks, Jerome.” </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F27%2Ffeds-new-inflation-strategy-matters" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/laura-slams-louisiana-coastline?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Laura Slams Louisiana
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Damage from Laura" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjM3L2RhbWFnZV9mcm9tX2xhdXJhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>STRINGER/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Laura, one of the most powerful hurricanes ever to hit the U.S., <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/Hurricane%20Laura%20Live%20Updates/2020/08/27/906713584/hurricane-lauras-intense-winds-cut-through-louisiana-coastline?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crashed</a> into the Louisiana coast early yesterday morning as a Category 4 storm before weakening significantly. Houses and businesses were flattened. Officials have confirmed at least six deaths. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The industrial city of Lake Charles (pop. 80,000) was <a href="https://apnews.com/45ba32bafe5da34b5691544ecb3e5492?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">particularly pounded</a>—police spotted a casino that had been unmoored and was floating on by. And first responders were trying to stamp out a fire that had broken out at a chemical manufacturing facility. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The cleanup is just beginning and authorities will assess the damage in the coming days. One piece of good news? The storm surge was <a href="https://www.axios.com/louisiana-hurricane-laura-surge-b70df62b-9a11-404b-874b-add011a79c2d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">far lower</a> than feared.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F27%2Flaura-slams-louisiana-coastline" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/walmart-announces-plans-buy-tiktok-microsoft?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Name a More Iconic Trio
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kim, Khloé, and Kourtney. Eggs, cheese, and ketchup. Microsoft, TikTok, and...Walmart? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Walmart turned Business Twitter sideways yesterday when it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/27/walmart-is-teaming-up-with-microsoft-on-tiktok-bid.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to Teams up with Microsoft to purchase TikTok’s U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand operations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Catching you up: </strong>The Trump administration has forced TikTok's Chinese owners to sell the video app to a U.S. company over national security concerns. The price tag? In the $20–$30 billion range, per CNBC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What a big-box retailer gets from a partnership with a software company to buy a social media company:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A boost to e-commerce. Walmart has a membership program in the works called Walmart+, which it hopes will unseat a rival that rhymes with Bamazon Brime. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Second, a huge new advertising market. TikTok has nearly 100 million monthly active users in the U.S. who may be in for a lot more “Save Money. Live Better.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead..</strong>.a decision from TikTok <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/27/technology/walmart-tiktok-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will reportedly</a> arrive “in the coming days.” But it'll be without CEO Kevin Mayer, who resigned abruptly Wednesday night. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY GRAZE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
‘Beep Boop Tasty Grass Beep Boop’ — Robot
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Graze" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTI1NC8xNTk4MzEwNDQ1LTE1OTcyMDE0MjMtMTU5Njk5NTkzMy0yLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Beep boop mmm,” says <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Graze</a>, the <strong style="color:#000">autonomous, commercial lawn-mowing robot</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Much munch beep boop tasty,” <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Graze</a> continues. “Beep boop <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest in me</a>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s right—Graze isn’t just in a great mood because of how good that grass tastes; Graze is happy because it’s <strong style="color:#000">successfully disrupting the $53 billion dollar landscaping industry</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And now you have the chance <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to invest</a>—but <strong style="color:#000">only until 9/18 when this round closes</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This robot lawnmower is a beeping gamechanger. It eliminates <strong style="color:#000">75% of fuel costs</strong>! Graze robotic mowers are <strong style="color:#000">100% electric</strong> and <strong style="color:#000">solar powered</strong>! Cut costs and cut grass, people!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Beep boop come <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">munch on some money</a>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=dailybrew&utm_campaign=8_28" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Invest in the mower of the future right now</a>.</p>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/bon-apptit-hires-dawn-davis-editorinchief?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A New Dawn at Bon Appétit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Dawn Davis" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjM4L2Rhd25fZGF2aXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Brian Stukes/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Condé Nast announced publishing exec Dawn Davis will <a href="https://www.eater.com/2020/8/27/21404536/dawn-davis-replaces-adam-rapoport-as-bon-appetit-editor-in-chief?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take over</a> as editor-in-chief of Bon Appétit this November, where she’ll oversee the food media brand’s magazine and popular Test Kitchen video franchise.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At Simon & Schuster, Davis launched the 37 Ink imprint, which focuses on publishing books by authors from marginalized communities. She’ll be the fourth Black person to lead one of Condé Nast’s U.S. publications. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">She’s got grease fires to put out</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier this summer, as protests over the killing of George Floyd spread across the country, Bon Appétit faced its own reckoning over allegations of racism and unequal compensation for employees of color.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Former editor-in-chief Adam Rapoport stepped down in June after a writer shared a photo of him wearing brownface in 2013. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the last month, seven Bon Appétit personalities <a href="https://www.grubstreet.com/2020/08/three-bon-appetit-test-kitchen-stars-quit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped down</a> from appearing in Test Kitchen videos, including several employees of color, after negotiations to address pay inequities stalled. Some of those chefs remain on the magazine’s editorial team.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The scandal at Bon Appétit has played out very publicly, with employees using social media to pressure the company for change and call it out when it failed to do so.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Editor's note: A previous version of this article stated Davis was the third Black person to lead one of Condé Nast’s U.S. publications.</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/amazon-unveils-first-fitness-tracker-halo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon’s Halo Effect
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon Halo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjM1L2FtYXpvbl9oYWxvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Business Wire</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Amazon <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/27/21402493/amazon-halo-band-health-fitness-body-scan-tone-emotion-activity-sleep?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">anointed</a> its first major play in the wearables market with wings. The Halo wristband packs all the must-have trackers—cardio, sleep, heart rate, temperature—but two new features may be more polarizing than chewing on ice cream:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tone</strong></span><span> uses built-in microphones to periodically listen to a user’s voice and log their emotional state. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Body</strong></span><span> creates a 3D body scan using smartphone photos, then uses AI to calculate body fat percentage. After five months pounding quarantine Cheez-Its, count us out. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Halo doesn’t include a screen (users access their stats through a smartphone app), and Amazon will keep user profiles separate from Prime accounts. It’s also breaking from the industry norm by charging a $4/month subscription.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Until now, Amazon has mostly focused on tricking out your home with smart devices. With Halo, it’s making a play for the estimated $52 billion wearables market and complementing its other efforts around telehealth, employer healthcare, and pharmacy delivery in the $3.5 trillion healthcare sector. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>it’ll be playing catch up. The Apple Watch <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/08/21/apple-led-smartwatch-market-first-half-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">locked in</a> 51% of smartwatch shipment revenues in the first half of 2020.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For years, the Brew has been known for summarizing the day’s news in a fun, digestible format. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/feds-new-inflation-strategy-matters?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhy the Fed’s New Inflation Strategy Matters\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Jerome Powell giving a speech\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMzL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGxfZ2l2aW5nX2Ffc3BlZWNoLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKansas City Fed\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Fed Chair Jerome Powell \u003cem\u003elooks\u003c/em\u003e like he’s giving James Bond instructions for a new mission, we can assure you he is talking about a much more exciting topic: monetary policy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/507c21034e441490006e877b080d9584?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekeynote address\u003c/a\u003e at the Fed’s annual policy symposium, Powell revealed a major update to the central bank’s basic framework for steering the economy through good times and bad.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe update: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed now wants inflation (the rise in prices) to run at a 2% \u003cem\u003eaverage\u003c/em\u003e, rather than a concrete bullseye it needs to hit. That means it will be comfortable with inflation climbing above 2%, a prospect that at one point would scare the bejesus out of central bankers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reason behind the shift: \u003c/strong\u003ePowell and his pals thought that historically low unemployment—like the kind we had in 2019—would push up prices and cause higher inflation, but...that \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/03/upshot/unemployment-inflation-changing-economic-fundamentals.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enever happened\u003c/a\u003e. Inflation consistently came in below the 2% target despite pretty much everyone having a job. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new change, in Powell’s words, “reflects our view that a robust job market can be sustained without causing an outbreak of inflation.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat it means for you \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fed typically hikes interest rates when it’s worried inflation might run too hot. But as we mentioned, it just kissed those worries goodbye. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat means interest rates, which the Fed dropped to near-zero in the early days of the pandemic, could stay \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-27/powell-says-fed-to-seek-inflation-that-averages-2-over-time?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003elow\u003c/a\u003e for a \u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003elong time. The Fed’s benchmark interest rate sets the standard for borrowing costs across the economy, influencing everything from mortgages to the yield on your savings account. So whenever you lock in a super low rate on your home loan or earn $1 in interest over the next year, just say “Thanks, Jerome.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F27%2Ffeds-new-inflation-strategy-matters\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Houses and businesses were flattened. Officials have confirmed at least six deaths. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe industrial city of Lake Charles (pop. 80,000) was \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/45ba32bafe5da34b5691544ecb3e5492?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eparticularly pounded\u003c/a\u003e—police spotted a casino that had been unmoored and was floating on by. And first responders were trying to stamp out a fire that had broken out at a chemical manufacturing facility. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe cleanup is just beginning and authorities will assess the damage in the coming days. One piece of good news? The storm surge was \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/louisiana-hurricane-laura-surge-b70df62b-9a11-404b-874b-add011a79c2d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" The price tag? In the $20–$30 billion range, per CNBC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat a big-box retailer gets from a partnership with a software company to buy a social media company:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA boost to e-commerce. Walmart has a membership program in the works called Walmart+, which it hopes will unseat a rival that rhymes with Bamazon Brime. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSecond, a huge new advertising market. media brand’s magazine and popular Test Kitchen video franchise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt Simon \u0026 Schuster, Davis launched the 37 Ink imprint, which focuses on publishing books by authors from marginalized communities. She’ll be the fourth Black person to lead one of Condé Nast’s U.S. publications. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eShe’s got grease fires to put out\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier this summer, as protests over the killing of George Floyd spread across the country, Bon Appétit faced its own reckoning over allegations of racism and unequal compensation for employees of color.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFormer editor-in-chief Adam Rapoport stepped down in June after a writer shared a photo of him wearing brownface in 2013. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the last month, seven Bon Appétit personalities \u003ca href=\"https://www.grubstreet.com/2020/08/three-bon-appetit-test-kitchen-stars-quit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped down\u003c/a\u003e from appearing in Test Kitchen videos, including several employees of color, after negotiations to address pay inequities stalled. Some of those chefs remain on the magazine’s editorial team.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe scandal at Bon Appétit has played out very publicly, with employees using social media to pressure the company for change and call it out when it failed to do so.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEditor's note: A previous version of this article stated Davis was the third Black person to lead one of Condé Nast’s U.S. publications.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F27%2Fbon-apptit-hires-dawn-davis-editorinchief\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjM1L2FtYXpvbl9oYWxvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBusiness Wire\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Amazon \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/27/21402493/amazon-halo-band-health-fitness-body-scan-tone-emotion-activity-sleep?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanointed\u003c/a\u003e its first major play in the wearables market with wings. The Halo wristband packs all the must-have trackers—cardio, sleep, heart rate, temperature—but two new features may be more polarizing than chewing on ice cream:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTone\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e uses built-in microphones to periodically listen to a user’s voice and log their emotional state. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBody\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e creates a 3D body scan using smartphone photos, then uses AI to calculate body fat percentage. After five months pounding quarantine Cheez-Its, count us out. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHalo doesn’t include a screen (users access their stats through a smartphone app), and Amazon will keep user profiles separate from Prime accounts. It’s also breaking from the industry norm by charging a $4/month subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eUntil now, Amazon has mostly focused on tricking out your home with smart devices. With Halo, it’s making a play for the estimated $52 billion wearables market and complementing its other efforts around telehealth, employer healthcare, and pharmacy delivery in the $3.5 trillion healthcare sector. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eit’ll be playing catch up.
